issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:

fields.summary: Nimbus did not come up after restart

comments.body:
More details on description below:
(This was copied from dev@ mailing list what I've posted)

1. There were three Nimbuses N1, N2, N3 and N1 was the leader.
2. We submitted topology T1.
3. After submission we restarted N1 and N2 got leadership.
4. We killed T1. 
5. While N1 is initializing and syncing up its topology blobs, N2 concurrently removes the ZK path and also max sequence number path for topology blob in progress of killing topology. 

This race condition is only occurring on Local BlobStore since removing ZK path is done only if Nimbus is using Local BlobStore.

More details for stack trace on description:
https://github.com/apache/storm/blob/1.x-branch/storm-core/src/jvm/org/apache/storm/blobstore/KeySequenceNumber.java#L138-L149

checkExists (L138) succeeds but getChildren (L149) throws NoNodeException, in result sequenceNumbers.last() throws NoSuchElementException.
Lowering priority since this is occurred only for Nimbus H/A and race condition during failover. I don't think it should block further releases.

I'm asking questions to the dev@ mailing list to make my suspects clear.
Mail thread link is [here|http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/storm-dev/201701.mbox/%3CCAF5108hmjjh=fexbPiaXCgL+JKK8mXFCfJYuj5jF5xyih_XcFQ@mail.gmail.com%3E]
[~kabhwan] Does this only affect the 1.0.x line, or is 1.x affected as well?

[~ptgoetz]
I guess this affects starting from 1.0.0 to master. Might be better to also add 1.1.0 and 2.0.0 to affects versions.

Merged into master and 1.x branch via [~sriharsha].
I'll handle porting back to 1.0.x after 1.0.3 RC1 vote.

worklogs.comment:
GitHub user HeartSaVioR opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1904

    STORM-2321 Handle blobstore zk key deletion in KeySequenceNumber

    * If NoNodeException is thrown in getKeySequenceNumber, treat it as KeyNotFoundException
    * Change callers to handle KeyNotFoundException accordingly
    
    Race condition with a deletion is rare case, so instead of adding some locks to prevent race condition, it just allows error and handle it accordingly.
    
    I'll also craft pull request for 1.x branch as well.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/HeartSaVioR/storm STORM-2321

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1904.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #1904
    
----
commit ff7204385976e2de8099b5fffa858ae29db8c5a8
Author: Jungtaek Lim <kabhwan@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-01-31T08:00:31Z

    STORM-2321 Handle blobstore zk key deletion in KeySequenceNumber
    
    * If NoNodeException is thrown in getKeySequenceNumber, treat it as KeyNotFoundException
    * Change callers to handle KeyNotFoundException accordingly

----

GitHub user HeartSaVioR opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1905

    STORM-2321 Handle blobstore zk key deletion in KeySequenceNumber (1.x)

    * If NoNodeException is thrown in getKeySequenceNumber, treat it as KeyNotFoundException
    * Change callers to handle KeyNotFoundException accordingly

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/HeartSaVioR/storm STORM-2321-1.x

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1905.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #1905
    
----
commit 3f1e5cf95c47ae9068d03acb52e2903dac99644c
Author: Jungtaek Lim <kabhwan@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-01-31T08:00:31Z

    STORM-2321 Handle blobstore zk key deletion in KeySequenceNumber
    
    * If NoNodeException is thrown in getKeySequenceNumber, treat it as KeyNotFoundException
    * Change callers to handle KeyNotFoundException accordingly

----

Github user harshach commented on the issue:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1904
  
    +1

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1905

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1904

GitHub user HeartSaVioR opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1931

    Convert NoNodeException to KeyNotFoundException in getNimbodesWithLatestSequenceNumberOfBlob

    * since callers are able to handle KeyNotFoundException but not NoNodeException
    
    This patch is addressing missed spot on [STORM-2321](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/STORM-2321).
    
    It doesn't mean patch for STORM-2321 is broken (just found a missing case), so it doesn't hurt the release vote for 1.0.3 RC2.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/HeartSaVioR/storm fix-nonodeexception-getNimbodesWithLatestSequenceNumberOfBlob

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1931.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #1931
    
----
commit 677971d876f9ff35801cdaaf81a025f592c72059
Author: Jungtaek Lim <kabhwan@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-02-08T04:59:39Z

    Convert NoNodeException to KeyNotFoundException in getNimbodesWithLatestSequenceNumberOfBlob
    
    * since callers are able to handle KeyNotFoundException but not NoNodeException

----

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1931
